description: Rear roof extension to rear outrigger roofslope
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) and documents: Design and Access Statement, Top Floor Flat, 6 Ramsay Road, W3 8AZ, dated November 2016; Proposed Front / Rear Elevations, Drawing No. RMSAY-E101, dated November 2016; Proposed Side Elevation, Drawing No. RMSAY-E102, dated November 2016; Proposed - Location Plans, Drawing No. RMSAY-L101, dated November 2016; Proposed - Ground Floor Plan, Drawing No. RMSAY-P101, dated November 2016; Proposed - First Floor, Drawing No. RMSAY-P102, dated November 2016; Proposed - Loft Plan, Drawing No. RMSAY-P103, dated November 2016; Proposed - Roof Plan, Drawing No. RMSAY-P104, dated November 2016; Proposed - Section AA, Drawing No. RMSAY-S101, dated November 2016; Proposed - Section BB, Drawing No. RMSAY-S101, dated November 2016
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse, and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies 7.4 & 7.6 of The London Plan ((2015) and Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), polices 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013)

| Prior to the development hereby permitted being first occupied, the window proposed to be located on the Side Elevation shall be glazed with obscured glass, and this glazing shall be maintained for the life of the development unless alternative arrangements are approved in writing by the local planning authority.

REASON: To safeguard the amenities and privacy of the occupiers of adjoining properties, in accordance with section 7 pf the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015.
